main event: One soft glowing yellow object was observed traveling 1,100 feet in 2 to 3 seconds in Birmingham, Alabama on November 7, 1957. The object was seen through the windshield of a car.
interesting points: The object traveled at a high speed, covering 1,100 feet in only 2 to 3 seconds.
The witness reported that the car began misfiring and almost stalled when the object drifted directly at him.
The yellow light of the object was described to be as bright as a car headlight.
The object was about 1/2 the size of the full moon and of a yellow-white color.
The conclusion from the report was a probable meteor sighting, indicating a natural explanation for the observed phenomenon.
witnesses: Given B. Cert, Given B. Yellon, D.D.
